Direct Known Subclasses:
LifecycleTesterImpl
public class TestBlockImpl
extends EventCompoundImpl
implements TestBlock

created 13-Oct-2006 16:46:44 The testblock sends out lifecycle events to anyone interested; this can be used by monitors to walk the testblock through a controlled state sequence, and to await test results. Test results are notified as a TestCompletedEvent

sfStart

public void sfStart()
             throws SmartFrogException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
Starts the compound. This sends a synchronous sfStart to all managed components in the compound context. Any failure will cause the compound to terminate A TestStartedEvent will always be sent.

Specified by:
sfStart in interface Prim
Overrides:
sfStart in class CompoundImpl
Throws:
SmartFrogException - failed to start compound
java.rmi.RemoteException - In case of Remote/nework error

startChildAction

protected void startChildAction()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                SmartFrogException
Called in sfStart to start the child action. Can be overridden to disable that action, in which case some derived form of the logic must be repeated to start the action and (always) send a TestStartedEvent.

Throws:
SmartFrogException - failed to start compound
java.rmi.RemoteException - In case of Remote/nework error

Parameters:
record - exit status

onChildTerminated

protected boolean onChildTerminated(TerminationRecord record,
                                    Prim comp)
                             throws SmartFrogRuntimeException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException
This is an override point; it is where subclasses get to change their workflow depending on what happens underneath. It is only called outside of component termination, i.e. when EventCompoundImpl.isWorkflowTerminating() is false, and when the comp parameter is a child, that is sfContainsChild(comp) holds. If the the method returns true, the event is forwarded up the object heirarchy, which will eventually trigger a component termination.

Always return false if you start new components from this method!

Overrides:
onChildTerminated in class EventCompoundImpl
Parameters:
record - exit record of the component
comp - child component that is terminating
Returns:
true if the termination event is to be forwarded up the chain.
Throws:
SmartFrogRuntimeException - for runtime exceptions
java.rmi.RemoteException - for network problems

setTestBlockAttributes

public void setTestBlockAttributes(TerminationRecord record,
                                   boolean timeout)
                            throws SmartFrogRuntimeException,
                                   java.rmi.RemoteException
Set the various attributes of the component based on whether the test record was success or not

java.rmi.RemoteException - network errors
